6. 잡기능

A. pd.cut, pd.qcut

pd.qcut(np.random.randn(100),q=4)
Interval(-1.884, -0.609, closed='right')
pd.qcut(range(5), 3, labels=["good", "medium", "bad"])
['good', 'good', 'medium', 'bad', 'bad']
Categories (3, object): ['good' < 'medium' < 'bad']
pd.qcut?
Signature:
pd.qcut(
    x,
    q,
    labels=None,
    retbins: 'bool' = False,
    precision: 'int' = 3,
    duplicates: 'str' = 'raise',
)
Docstring:
Quantile-based discretization function.
Discretize variable into equal-sized buckets based on rank or based
on sample quantiles. For example 1000 values for 10 quantiles would
produce a Categorical object indicating quantile membership for each data point.
Parameters
----------
x : 1d ndarray or Series
q : int or list-like of float
    Number of quantiles. 10 for deciles, 4 for quartiles, etc. Alternately
    array of quantiles, e.g. [0, .25, .5, .75, 1.] for quartiles.
labels : array or False, default None
    Used as labels for the resulting bins. Must be of the same length as
    the resulting bins. If False, return only integer indicators of the
    bins. If True, raises an error.
retbins : bool, optional
    Whether to return the (bins, labels) or not. Can be useful if bins
    is given as a scalar.
precision : int, optional
    The precision at which to store and display the bins labels.
duplicates : {default 'raise', 'drop'}, optional
    If bin edges are not unique, raise ValueError or drop non-uniques.
Returns
-------
out : Categorical or Series or array of integers if labels is False
    The return type (Categorical or Series) depends on the input: a Series
    of type category if input is a Series else Categorical. Bins are
    represented as categories when categorical data is returned.
bins : ndarray of floats
    Returned only if `retbins` is True.
Notes
-----
Out of bounds values will be NA in the resulting Categorical object
Examples
--------
>>> pd.qcut(range(5), 4)
... # doctest: +ELLIPSIS
[(-0.001, 1.0], (-0.001, 1.0], (1.0, 2.0], (2.0, 3.0], (3.0, 4.0]]
Categories (4, interval[float64, right]): [(-0.001, 1.0] < (1.0, 2.0] ...
>>> pd.qcut(range(5), 3, labels=["good", "medium", "bad"])
... # doctest: +SKIP
[good, good, medium, bad, bad]
Categories (3, object): [good < medium < bad]
>>> pd.qcut(range(5), 4, labels=False)
array([0, 0, 1, 2, 3])
File:      ~/anaconda3/envs/ag/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pandas/core/reshape/tile.py
Type:      function

D. 형태변환

B. go.Scatter

-

fig = go.Figure()
fig
# dict(x=[1,2,3],y=[2,3,4])
go_scatter1 = go.Scatter(x=[1,2,3],y=[2,3,4])
go_scatter2 = go.Scatter(x=[1,2,3],y=[2,3,-3])
fig.add_trace(go_scatter1).add_trace(go_scatter2)
fig = go.Figure()
fig.add_bar(x=[1,2,3],y=[2,3,1])
fig.add_scatter(x=[1,2,3],y=[2,3,1])
fig.data[0]['name']='y_bar'
fig.data[1]['name']='y_line'
fig.data[0]['legendgroup']='y'
fig.data[1]['legendgroup']='y'
fig

- selector의 역할.. 너무 어려운뎅? (지정안하면 전체업데이트함)

fig = go.Figure()
fig.add_bar(x=[1,2,3],y=[2,3,1],name='y_bar')
fig.add_scatter(x=[1,2,3],y=[2,3,1],name='y_line')
fig.update_traces(marker_color='orange',selector={'name':'y_line'})
fig

go.Scatter

- 예시1

fig = go.Figure()
scatter = go.Scatter(
    x=[1,2,3],y=[2,3,-1]
)
fig.add_trace(scatter)

- 예시2

fig = go.Figure()
scatter = go.Scatter(
    x=[1,2,3],y=[2,3,-1],
    mode='lines'
)
fig.add_trace(scatter)

- 예시3

fig = go.Figure()
scatter = go.Scatter(
    x=[1,2,3],y=[2,3,-1],
    mode='markers'
)
fig.add_trace(scatter)

- 예시4

fig = go.Figure()
scatter = go.Scatter(
    x=[1,2,3],y=[2,3,-1],
    mode='lines+markers'
)
fig.add_trace(scatter)

- 예시5

fig = go.Figure()
scatter = go.Scatter(
    x=[1,2,3],y=[2,3,-1],
    mode='lines+markers',
    name='test'
)
fig.add_trace(scatter)

- 예시6

fig = go.Figure()
scatter = go.Scatter(
    x=[1,2,3],y=[2,3,-1],
    mode='lines+markers',
    name='test',
    marker={'color':'red','size':10,'symbol':'circle','line':{'width':2,'color':'blue'}}
)
fig.add_trace(scatter)
fig.data
(Scatter({
     'marker': {'color': 'red', 'line': {'color': 'blue', 'width': 2}, 'size': 10, 'symbol': 'circle'},
     'mode': 'lines+markers',
     'name': 'test',
     'x': [1, 2, 3],
     'y': [2, 3, -1]
 }),)
fig = go.Figure()
scatter = go.Scatter(
    {
     'marker': {'color': 'red', 'line': {'color': 'blue', 'width': 2}, 'size': 10, 'symbol': 'circle'},
     'mode': 'lines+markers',
     'name': 'test',
     'x': [1, 2, 3],
     'y': [2, 3, -1]
 }  
)
fig.add_trace(scatter)

- 예시7

fig = go.Figure()
scatter = go.Scatter(
    x=[1,2,3],y=[2,3,-1],
    mode='lines+markers',
    name='test',
    marker={'color':'red','size':10,'symbol':'circle','line':{'width':2,'color':'blue'}},
    line={'width':0.5,'color':'green'}
)
fig.add_trace(scatter)

- 색상변경

fig = pd.DataFrame({'x':[1,2,3,4],'y':[1,2,4,3],'clr':['A','A','B','B']})\
.plot.line(
    x='x',y='y',
)
fig.update_traces(
    line_color = 'red',
    line_dash= 'dash'
)

- 색상변경2

pd.DataFrame({'x':[1,2,3,4],'y':[1,2,4,3],'clr':['A','A','B','B']})\
.plot.line(
    x='x',y='y',color='clr'
)
pd.DataFrame({'x':[1,2,3,4],'y':[1,2,4,3],'clr':['A','A','B','B']})\
.plot.line(
    x='x',y='y',color='clr'
)
pd.DataFrame({'x':[1,2,3,4],'y':[1,2,4,3],'clr':['A','A','B','B']})\
.plot.line(
    x='x',y='y',color='clr',
    category_orders= {'clr':['B','A']}
)
pd.DataFrame({'x':[1,2,3,4],'y':[1,2,4,3],'clr':['A','A','B','B']})\
.plot.line(
    x='x',y='y',color='clr',
    color_discrete_sequence = ['orange','green'],
    
)
pd.DataFrame({'x':[1,2,3,4],'y':[1,2,4,3],'clr':['A','A','B','B']})\
.plot.line(
    x='x',y='y',color='clr',
    color_discrete_map = {'B':'orange','A':'green'},
)

- 라인의 타입변경

- dot-connected plot

pd.DataFrame({'x':[1,2,3,4],'y':[1,2,4,3],'clr':['A','A','B','B']})\
.plot.line(
    x='x',y='y',color='clr',
    color_discrete_map = {'B':'orange','A':'green'}
)
pd.DataFrame({'x':[1,2,3,4],'y':[1,2,4,3],'clr':['A','A','B','B']})\
.plot.line(
    x='x',y='y',color='clr',
    color_discrete_map = {'B':'orange','A':'green'}
)
_fig
go.Figure().add_trace(_fig.data[0]).add_trace(_fig.data[1]).update_layout(_fig.layout)
_fig.layout['legend']['title']['text']='변수이름'
_fig

3. 기본예제

x= np.linspace(0,5,100)
y= np.sin(2*x)
px.line(
    x=x,y=y,
    #---#
    title = "예시1: 간단한 라인플랏",
)

- x,y축의 이름 수정

x= np.linspace(0,5,100)
y= np.sin(2*x)
fig = px.line(
    x=x,y=y,
    #---#
    title = "예시2: 간단한 라인플랏 (x,y-axis 수정)"
)
print(fig.layout)
fig['layout']['xaxis']['title']['text'] = r'$x\text{-axis}$'
fig['layout']['yaxis']['title']['text'] = r'$y\text{-axis}$'
fig
Layout({
    'legend': {'tracegroupgap': 0},
    'template': '...',
    'title': {'text': '예시2: 간단한 라인플랏 (x,y-axis 수정)'},
    'xaxis': {'anchor': 'y', 'domain': [0.0, 1.0], 'title': {'text': 'x'}},
    'yaxis': {'anchor': 'x', 'domain': [0.0, 1.0], 'title': {'text': 'y'}}
})

- x,y축의 이름 수정

x= np.linspace(0,5,100)
y1= np.sin(2*x)
y2= np.cos(2*x)
fig = px.line(
    x=x,y=[y1,y2],
    #---#
    title = "예시3: 겹쳐그리기 (x,y-axis 수정) "
)
fig['layout']['xaxis']['title']['text'] = r'$x\text{-axis}$'
fig['layout']['yaxis']['title']['text'] = r'$y\text{-axis}$'
fig
x= np.linspace(0,5,100)
y1= np.sin(2*x)
y2= np.cos(2*x)
fig = px.line(
    x=x,y=[y1,y2],
    #---#
    title = "예시4: 겹쳐그리기 (x,y-axis 수정 + label 수정)"
)
fig['layout']['xaxis']['title']['text'] = r'$x\text{-axis}$'
fig['layout']['yaxis']['title']['text'] = r'$y\text{-axis}$'
fig['data'][0]['name'] = r'$\sin(2x)$'
fig['data'][1]['name'] = r'$\cos(2x)$'
fig
x= np.linspace(0,5,100)
y1= np.sin(2*x)
y2= np.cos(2*x)
fig = px.line(
    x=x,y=[y1,y2],
    #---#
    title = "예시5: 겹쳐그리기 (x,y-axis 수정 + label 수정 + 선의타입수정)"
)
fig['layout']['xaxis']['title']['text'] = r'$x\text{-axis}$'
fig['layout']['yaxis']['title']['text'] = r'$y\text{-axis}$'
fig['data'][0]['name'] = r'$\sin(2x)$'
fig['data'][1]['name'] = r'$\cos(2x)$'
fig
x= np.linspace(0,5,100)
y1= np.sin(2*x)
y2= np.cos(2*x)
fig = px.line(
    x=x,y=[y1,y2],
    #---#
    title = "예시6: 겹쳐그리기 (x,y-axis 수정 + label 수정 + 선의타입수정 + 모드변경)"
)
fig['layout']['xaxis']['title']['text'] = r'$x\text{-axis}$'
fig['layout']['yaxis']['title']['text'] = r'$y\text{-axis}$'
fig['data'][0]['name'] = r'$\sin(2x)$'
fig['data'][1]['name'] = r'$\cos(2x)$'
fig['data'][0]['line']['dash'] = 'dash'
fig['data'][1]['mode'] = 'lines+markers'
fig

4. px.scatter

px.scatter(
    x=[1,2,3],y=[2,3,4],
    #---#
)
